page.title: 19Leisure and Recreation 3
page.content: {THE RIFLE RANGE}The Uckfield Home Guard Rifle Club was formed in 1944. It is held at East Hoathly Playing Fields. Mr.A.Petit runs it. It is self supporting from membership and fund raising, there are 50 members. There is no starting age limit as long as they can hold a rifle safely. {STOOLBALL}This game is popular in Sussex and is played on the Recreation Ground by men, women and children. The wickets are white square boards on posts and the players run between them to score. The bat has a round, flat surface for sriking the ball. {OTHER SPORTS}Table Tennis is played in the Pavilion, there is clay pigeon shootig near Graywood and some fishing in the many ponds.
